result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony L. Perkins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Judgment for unpaid fine/forfeiture/other not sent; no current address.
Reminder Notice to Defendant. USPS indicates in dispute; return to sender; unable to forward.
Reminder Notice indicating amount due mailed to defendant.

(22CF279, 22CF368, 22CM163 are called at 11:32 AM) Defendant Anthony L. Perkins in court, in custody.  Attorney Melissa M. Petersen in court for Anthony L. Perkins.  Attorney Monica A Fallon in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense indicates there is an agreement. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Defendant indicates he has not taken any of his medications while incarcerated. Defendant states it does not affect his ability to move forward today. Defendant pleads No Contest to 22CF279 Count 1- Possession of Methamphetamine. Court accepts plea and finds the Defendant guilty. Victim/Witness statute complied with. Remaining charges are dismissed and read in including 22CF368, 22CM163, 22TR1455. 
Court withholds sentence and orders years Probation with the following conditions: 90 days jail without Huber, all stayed pending further order of the court; No contact with any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting; Maintain absolute sobriety; Mental Health Evaluation and follow through with any recommendation; Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations; Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge; Court costs. Court orders 2 days jail credit, if revoked.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 17, 2022 at 11:30 am.

9:35 AM cases 22CM163, 22CF368, 22CF279 called. Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Anthony L. Perkins in court, in custody.  Attorney Melissa M. Petersen in court for Anthony L. Perkins. 
In felony files 22CF279 and 22CF368: Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waivers. All cases are referred for ARGN (possible plea).
